structure.unit: SCHOOL EMPLOYEES -- TEACHERS' RETIREMENT AND TENURE

law.text:
Notwithstanding any other statute to the contrary, an experienced, out-of-state teacher shall qualify for a regular provisional certificate if the applicant:
Completes the application process;
Holds a valid certificate issued by the state where the applicant most recently taught; and
Holds a valid certificate issued by the National Board of Professional Teaching Standards.
law.history: Created 2000 Ky. Acts ch. 257, sec. 6, effective July 14, 2000.
